page.title: 12TRANSPORT
page.content: The roads are all minor ones linking the area with the A638 to the West.Local residents, farm traffic and delivery and collection vehicles(milk, animal foodstuffs, oil, general merchandise) use them. The East Midland Service 36 bus(The Sherwood Forester) links the villages with Retford,Tuxford and Ollerton.Four journeys proceed in each direction (weekdays) they are used lightly mainly by shoppers and children.Some households lack private transport. The railway from London to the North passes throgh the area;Retford is the nearest railhead.The line is being electrified;the poles are already positioned.Recent increases in train speeds have resulted in the closure of a public road crossing and certain farm occupation crossings. A loop is retained for slower southbound trains.
